intro: Senecio limosus, commonly known as the swamp knapweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Senecio limosus is often found in open areas such as grasslands and along waterways.
